result.execSummary:
The defendant Clark Webster Brinker V was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clark Webster Brinker V is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clark Webster Brinker V was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court suspends court costs and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clark Webster Brinker V

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & Jail. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF:  Clark Webster Brinker appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:48 p.m. Set for PTC.  DE does not file a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Court reviews verbally with the DE the Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

- Sentenced to 20 days St. Croix County Jail
- Credit for 20 days served with good time
- Court suspends court costs and surcharges
- 20 days to appeal.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence; filed by Attorney Alex Andrea.
Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Defendant is on a PO hold.
